intro: Ganua boerlageana, commonly known as the Boerlag's ganua, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Eastern Cape of South Africa. It is a small, herbaceous plant with delicate, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually pale green or white in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
